title: A Visual RAG Pipeline for Few-Shot Fine-Grained Product Classification
abstract: Despite the rapid evolution of learning and computer vision algorithms, Fine-Grained Classification (FGC) still poses an open problem in many practically relevant applications. In the retail domain, for example, the identification of fast changing and visually highly similar products and their properties are key to automated price-monitoring and product recommendation. This paper presents a novel Visual RAG pipeline that combines the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) approach and Vision Language Models (VLMs) for few-shot FGC. This Visual RAG pipeline extracts product and promotion data in advertisement leaflets from various retailers and simultaneously predicts fine-grained product ids along with price and discount information. Compared to previous approaches, the key characteristic of the Visual RAG pipeline is that it allows the prediction of novel products without re-training, simply by adding a few class samples to the RAG database. Comparing several VLM back-ends like GPT-4o [23], GPT-4o-mini [24], and Gemini 2.0 Flash [10], our approach achieves 86.8% accuracy on a diverse dataset.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新颖的视觉RAG管道，结合了检索增强生成（RAG）方法和视觉语言模型（VLMs），用于少样本细粒度分类（FGC），在零售领域的广告传单中提取产品和促销数据，并预测细粒度产品ID及价格和折扣信息。
AI.motivation: 解决细粒度分类（FGC）在零售领域中的挑战，如快速变化和视觉高度相似的产品及其属性的识别，这对于自动化价格监控和产品推荐至关重要。
AI.method: 采用视觉RAG管道，结合RAG方法和VLMs，无需重新训练即可预测新产品，仅需向RAG数据库添加少量类样本。
AI.result: 在多种VLM后端（如GPT-4o、GPT-4o-mini和Gemini 2.0 Flash）的比较中，该方法在多样化数据集上达到了86.8%的准确率。
AI.conclusion: 视觉RAG管道为少样本细粒度产品分类提供了一种有效的解决方案，特别是在零售领域的应用中，展示了其在无需重新训练的情况下预测新产品的潜力。

title: Enhancing Web Agents with Explicit Rollback Mechanisms
abstract: With recent advancements in large language models, web agents have been greatly improved. However, dealing with complex and dynamic web environments requires more advanced planning and search abilities. Previous studies usually adopt a greedy one-way search strategy, which may struggle to recover from erroneous states. In this work, we enhance web agents with an explicit rollback mechanism, enabling the agent to revert back to a previous state in its navigation trajectory. This mechanism gives the model the flexibility to directly control the search process, leading to an effective and efficient web navigation method. We conduct experiments on two live web navigation benchmarks with zero-shot and fine-tuning settings. The results demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed approach.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种增强网络代理的方法，通过显式回滚机制使其能够在导航轨迹中回退到之前的状态，从而更有效地处理复杂和动态的网络环境。
AI.motivation: 解决网络代理在复杂和动态网络环境中因采用贪婪单向搜索策略而难以从错误状态恢复的问题。
AI.method: 引入显式回滚机制，使代理能够回退到导航轨迹中的先前状态，从而直接控制搜索过程。
AI.result: 在两个实时网络导航基准测试中，无论是零样本还是微调设置，所提出的方法都显示出了有效性。
AI.conclusion: 显式回滚机制显著提高了网络代理的导航效率和效果，为处理复杂网络环境提供了一种新方法。

title: GrabS: Generative Embodied Agent for 3D Object Segmentation without Scene Supervision
abstract: We study the hard problem of 3D object segmentation in complex point clouds without requiring human labels of 3D scenes for supervision. By relying on the similarity of pretrained 2D features or external signals such as motion to group 3D points as objects, existing unsupervised methods are usually limited to identifying simple objects like cars or their segmented objects are often inferior due to the lack of objectness in pretrained features. In this paper, we propose a new two-stage pipeline called GrabS. The core concept of our method is to learn generative and discriminative object-centric priors as a foundation from object datasets in the first stage, and then design an embodied agent to learn to discover multiple objects by querying against the pretrained generative priors in the second stage. We extensively evaluate our method on two real-world datasets and a newly created synthetic dataset, demonstrating remarkable segmentation performance, clearly surpassing all existing unsupervised methods.
subjects: Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Machine Learning (cs.LG); Robotics (cs.RO)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为GrabS的两阶段流程，用于无需场景监督的3D对象分割。该方法首先生成并区分对象中心先验，然后通过查询这些先验来发现多个对象，显著优于现有无监督方法。
AI.motivation: 解决在复杂点云中进行3D对象分割而不需要人类标注的3D场景监督的难题。现有无监督方法通常只能识别简单对象如汽车，或由于预训练特征中缺乏对象性而分割效果不佳。
AI.method: 提出GrabS两阶段流程：第一阶段从对象数据集中学习生成和区分对象中心先验；第二阶段设计一个体现代理，通过查询预训练的生成先验来学习发现多个对象。
AI.result: 在两个真实世界数据集和一个新创建的合成数据集上进行了广泛评估，展示了显著的分割性能，明显超过了所有现有的无监督方法。
AI.conclusion: GrabS方法通过学习和利用对象中心先验，有效地解决了无监督3D对象分割的问题，为复杂点云中的对象分割提供了新的解决方案。

title: Adapting a World Model for Trajectory Following in a 3D Game
abstract: Imitation learning is a powerful tool for training agents by leveraging expert knowledge, and being able to replicate a given trajectory is an integral part of it. In complex environments, like modern 3D video games, distribution shift and stochasticity necessitate robust approaches beyond simple action replay. In this study, we apply Inverse Dynamics Models (IDM) with different encoders and policy heads to trajectory following in a modern 3D video game -- Bleeding Edge. Additionally, we investigate several future alignment strategies that address the distribution shift caused by the aleatoric uncertainty and imperfections of the agent. We measure both the trajectory deviation distance and the first significant deviation point between the reference and the agent's trajectory and show that the optimal configuration depends on the chosen setting. Our results show that in a diverse data setting, a GPT-style policy head with an encoder trained from scratch performs the best, DINOv2 encoder with the GPT-style policy head gives the best results in the low data regime, and both GPT-style and MLP-style policy heads had comparable results when pre-trained on a diverse setting and fine-tuned for a specific behaviour setting.
subjects: Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV); Machine Learning (cs.LG)

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了在现代3D视频游戏《Bleeding Edge》中，通过应用逆动力学模型（IDM）与不同编码器和策略头进行轨迹跟随的方法。研究还调查了几种未来对齐策略，以解决由随机不确定性和代理不完美性引起的分布偏移。结果表明，在不同数据设置下，不同配置表现最佳。
AI.motivation: 解决在现代3D视频游戏中，由于分布偏移和随机性导致的轨迹跟随问题，超越简单的动作重放，需要更鲁棒的方法。
AI.method: 应用逆动力学模型（IDM）与不同编码器和策略头，并研究几种未来对齐策略，以应对分布偏移。
AI.result: 在多样化数据设置中，从头开始训练的GPT风格策略头表现最佳；在低数据情况下，DINOv2编码器与GPT风格策略头组合效果最好；在预训练于多样化设置并针对特定行为设置微调时，GPT风格和MLP风格策略头表现相当。
AI.conclusion: 研究表明，不同的编码器和策略头组合在不同数据设置下对轨迹跟随任务的效果有显著差异，为复杂环境中的模仿学习提供了有价值的见解。

title: Multilingual Contextualization of Large Language Models for Document-Level Machine Translation
abstract: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated strong performance in sentence-level machine translation, but scaling to document-level translation remains challenging, particularly in modeling long-range dependencies and discourse phenomena across sentences and paragraphs. In this work, we propose a method to improve LLM-based long-document translation through targeted fine-tuning on high-quality document-level data, which we curate and introduce as DocBlocks. Our approach supports multiple translation paradigms, including direct document-to-document and chunk-level translation, by integrating instructions both with and without surrounding context. This enables models to better capture cross-sentence dependencies while maintaining strong sentence-level translation performance. Experimental results show that incorporating multiple translation paradigms improves document-level translation quality and inference speed compared to prompting and agent-based methods.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种通过针对高质量文档级数据（DocBlocks）进行微调的方法，以提高基于大型语言模型（LLM）的长文档翻译性能，支持多种翻译范式，包括直接文档到文档和块级翻译。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型在句子级机器翻译中表现出色，但在文档级翻译中，尤其是在建模跨句子和段落的长距离依赖和话语现象方面仍面临挑战。
AI.method: 通过集成有和没有周围上下文的指令，对高质量文档级数据进行针对性微调，支持多种翻译范式。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，与提示和基于代理的方法相比，结合多种翻译范式提高了文档级翻译质量和推理速度。
AI.conclusion: 该方法不仅能够更好地捕捉跨句子依赖，还能保持强大的句子级翻译性能，为文档级机器翻译提供了有效的解决方案。

title: GraphicBench: A Planning Benchmark for Graphic Design with Language Agents
abstract: Large Language Model (LLM)-powered agents have unlocked new possibilities for automating human tasks. While prior work has focused on well-defined tasks with specified goals, the capabilities of agents in creative design tasks with open-ended goals remain underexplored. We introduce GraphicBench, a new planning benchmark for graphic design that covers 1,079 user queries and input images across four design types. We further present GraphicTown, an LLM agent framework with three design experts and 46 actions (tools) to choose from for executing each step of the planned workflows in web environments. Experiments with six LLMs demonstrate their ability to generate workflows that integrate both explicit design constraints from user queries and implicit commonsense constraints. However, these workflows often do not lead to successful execution outcomes, primarily due to challenges in: (1) reasoning about spatial relationships, (2) coordinating global dependencies across experts, and (3) retrieving the most appropriate action per step. We envision GraphicBench as a challenging yet valuable testbed for advancing LLM-agent planning and execution in creative design tasks.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了GraphicBench，一个用于图形设计的规划基准，以及GraphicTown，一个基于大型语言模型（LLM）的代理框架，旨在探索LLM代理在开放目标创意设计任务中的能力。
AI.motivation: 探索大型语言模型（LLM）代理在开放目标创意设计任务中的能力，填补了现有研究在明确目标任务之外的空白。
AI.method: 提出了GraphicBench基准和GraphicTown框架，后者包含三个设计专家和46个动作（工具），用于在网页环境中执行规划的工作流程。
AI.result: 实验表明，LLM能够生成整合用户查询中的显式设计约束和常识隐式约束的工作流程，但在执行过程中面临空间关系推理、跨专家全局依赖协调和每一步最合适动作检索等挑战。
AI.conclusion: GraphicBench作为一个具有挑战性但有价值的测试平台，有助于推进LLM代理在创意设计任务中的规划和执行能力。

title: Evaluating the Goal-Directedness of Large Language Models
abstract: To what extent do LLMs use their capabilities towards their given goal? We take this as a measure of their goal-directedness. We evaluate goal-directedness on tasks that require information gathering, cognitive effort, and plan execution, where we use subtasks to infer each model's relevant capabilities. Our evaluations of LLMs from Google DeepMind, OpenAI, and Anthropic show that goal-directedness is relatively consistent across tasks, differs from task performance, and is only moderately sensitive to motivational prompts. Notably, most models are not fully goal-directed. We hope our goal-directedness evaluations will enable better monitoring of LLM progress, and enable more deliberate design choices of agentic properties in LLMs.
subjects: Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Computation and Language (cs.CL); Machine Learning (cs.LG)

AI.tldr: 本文评估了大型语言模型（LLMs）的目标导向性，即在给定目标下利用其能力的程度。通过信息收集、认知努力和计划执行等任务，评估了Google DeepMind、OpenAI和Anthropic的LLMs，发现目标导向性在任务间相对一致，与任务表现不同，且对动机提示的敏感性适中。大多数模型并非完全目标导向。
AI.motivation: 评估LLMs在给定目标下利用其能力的程度，即目标导向性，以更好地监控LLMs的进展，并更审慎地设计LLMs的代理属性。
AI.method: 通过信息收集、认知努力和计划执行等任务，使用子任务推断每个模型的相关能力，评估了Google DeepMind、OpenAI和Anthropic的LLMs的目标导向性。
AI.result: 目标导向性在任务间相对一致，与任务表现不同，且对动机提示的敏感性适中。大多数模型并非完全目标导向。
AI.conclusion: 目标导向性评估有助于更好地监控LLMs的进展，并更审慎地设计LLMs的代理属性。大多数模型在目标导向性方面仍有改进空间。

title: Advancing Arabic Speech Recognition Through Large-Scale Weakly Supervised Learning
abstract: Automatic speech recognition (ASR) is crucial for human-machine interaction in diverse applications like conversational agents, industrial robotics, call center automation, and automated subtitling. However, developing high-performance ASR models remains challenging, particularly for low-resource languages like Arabic, due to the scarcity of large, labeled speech datasets, which are costly and labor-intensive to produce. In this work, we employ weakly supervised learning to train an Arabic ASR model using the Conformer architecture. Our model is trained from scratch on 15,000 hours of weakly annotated speech data covering both Modern Standard Arabic (MSA) and Dialectal Arabic (DA), eliminating the need for costly manual transcriptions. Despite the absence of human-verified labels, our approach attains state-of-the-art (SOTA) performance, exceeding all previous efforts in the field of Arabic ASR on the standard benchmarks. By demonstrating the effectiveness of weak supervision as a scalable, cost-efficient alternative to traditional supervised approaches, paving the way for improved ASR systems in low resource settings.

AI.tldr: 通过大规模弱监督学习推进阿拉伯语语音识别
AI.motivation: 解决阿拉伯语等低资源语言在自动语音识别(ASR)领域中，由于缺乏大型标注语音数据集而面临的挑战
AI.method: 使用Conformer架构，通过弱监督学习从15,000小时的弱标注语音数据（包括现代标准阿拉伯语和方言阿拉伯语）中训练阿拉伯语ASR模型
AI.result: 尽管缺乏人工验证的标签，该方法在阿拉伯语ASR的标准基准测试中达到了最先进的性能，超越了之前的所有努力
AI.conclusion: 弱监督学习作为一种可扩展、成本效益高的替代传统监督方法，展示了其在低资源环境下改进ASR系统的潜力

title: Enhancing Autonomous Driving Systems with On-Board Deployed Large Language Models
abstract: Neural Networks (NNs) trained through supervised learning struggle with managing edge-case scenarios common in real-world driving due to the intractability of exhaustive datasets covering all edge-cases, making knowledge-driven approaches, akin to how humans intuitively detect unexpected driving behavior, a suitable complement to data-driven methods. This work proposes a hybrid architecture combining low-level Model Predictive Controller (MPC) with locally deployed Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance decision-making and Human Machine Interaction (HMI). The DecisionxLLM module evaluates robotic state information against natural language instructions to ensure adherence to desired driving behavior. The MPCxLLM module then adjusts MPC parameters based on LLM-generated insights, achieving control adaptability while preserving the safety and constraint guarantees of traditional MPC systems. Further, to enable efficient on-board deployment and to eliminate dependency on cloud connectivity, we shift processing to the on-board computing platform: We propose an approach that exploits Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), Low Rank Adaptation (LoRA) fine-tuning, and quantization. Experimental results demonstrate that these enhancements yield significant improvements in reasoning accuracy by up to 10.45%, control adaptability by as much as 52.2%, and up to 10.5x increase in computational efficiency (tokens/s), validating the proposed framework's practicality for real-time deployment even on down-scaled robotic platforms. This work bridges high-level decision-making with low-level control adaptability, offering a synergistic framework for knowledge-driven and adaptive Autonomous Driving Systems (ADS).

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种结合低级模型预测控制器（MPC）和本地部署的大型语言模型（LLMs）的混合架构，以增强自动驾驶系统的决策制定和人机交互（HMI）。通过DecisionxLLM和MPCxLLM模块，系统能够根据自然语言指令调整MPC参数，实现控制适应性，同时保持传统MPC系统的安全和约束保证。此外，通过利用检索增强生成（RAG）、低秩适应（LoRA）微调和量化技术，实现了高效的板载部署，显著提高了推理准确性、控制适应性和计算效率。
AI.motivation: 解决监督学习训练的神经网络在管理现实驾驶中的边缘案例时的不足，因为这些案例无法通过详尽的数据集覆盖，需要类似于人类直觉检测意外驾驶行为的知识驱动方法来补充数据驱动方法。
AI.method: 提出了一种混合架构，结合了低级模型预测控制器（MPC）和本地部署的大型语言模型（LLMs），并利用检索增强生成（RAG）、低秩适应（LoRA）微调和量化技术实现高效的板载部署。
AI.result: 实验结果显示，这些增强措施使推理准确性提高了高达10.45%，控制适应性提高了多达52.2%，计算效率（tokens/s）提高了高达10.5倍，验证了所提出框架在实际部署中的实用性。
AI.conclusion: 这项工作将高级决策制定与低级控制适应性相结合，为知识驱动和自适应的自动驾驶系统（ADS）提供了一个协同框架，展示了在实时部署中的实际应用潜力。

title: REAL: Benchmarking Autonomous Agents on Deterministic Simulations of Real Websites
abstract: We introduce REAL, a benchmark and framework for multi-turn agent evaluations on deterministic simulations of real-world websites. REAL comprises high-fidelity, deterministic replicas of 11 widely-used websites across domains such as e-commerce, travel, communication, and professional networking. We also release a benchmark consisting of 112 practical tasks that mirror everyday complex user interactions requiring both accurate information retrieval and state-changing actions. All interactions occur within this fully controlled setting, eliminating safety risks and enabling robust, reproducible evaluation of agent capability and reliability. Our novel evaluation framework combines programmatic checks of website state for action-based tasks with rubric-guided LLM-based judgments for information retrieval. The framework supports both open-source and proprietary agent systems through a flexible evaluation harness that accommodates black-box commands within browser environments, allowing research labs to test agentic systems without modification. Our empirical results show that frontier language models achieve at most a 41% success rate on REAL, highlighting critical gaps in autonomous web navigation and task completion capabilities. Our framework supports easy integration of new tasks, reproducible evaluation, and scalable data generation for training web agents. The websites, framework, and leaderboard are available at

AI.tldr: REAL是一个用于多轮代理评估的基准和框架，基于真实网站的高保真确定性模拟。它包括11个广泛使用的网站和112个实用任务，旨在评估代理在信息检索和状态改变操作中的能力。
AI.motivation: 解决在真实网站环境中评估自主代理能力的挑战，提供一个安全、可重复的评估框架。
AI.method: 创建高保真、确定性的真实网站模拟，结合程序化检查和基于LLM的评分标准，评估代理的性能。
AI.result: 前沿语言模型在REAL上的成功率最高仅为41%，揭示了自主网页导航和任务完成能力的重大差距。
AI.conclusion: REAL框架支持新任务的轻松集成、可重复的评估和可扩展的数据生成，为训练网页代理提供了重要资源。

title: NodeRAG: Structuring Graph-based RAG with Heterogeneous Nodes
abstract: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) empowers large language models to access external and private corpus, enabling factually consistent responses in specific domains. By exploiting the inherent structure of the corpus, graph-based RAG methods further enrich this process by building a knowledge graph index and leveraging the structural nature of graphs. However, current graph-based RAG approaches seldom prioritize the design of graph structures. Inadequately designed graph not only impede the seamless integration of diverse graph algorithms but also result in workflow inconsistencies and degraded performance. To further unleash the potential of graph for RAG, we propose NodeRAG, a graph-centric framework introducing heterogeneous graph structures that enable the seamless and holistic integration of graph-based methodologies into the RAG workflow. By aligning closely with the capabilities of LLMs, this framework ensures a fully cohesive and efficient end-to-end process. Through extensive experiments, we demonstrate that NodeRAG exhibits performance advantages over previous methods, including GraphRAG and LightRAG, not only in indexing time, query time, and storage efficiency but also in delivering superior question-answering performance on multi-hop benchmarks and open-ended head-to-head evaluations with minimal retrieval tokens. Our GitHub repository could be seen at

AI.tldr: NodeRAG是一个图中心框架，通过引入异构图结构，将基于图的方法无缝整合到RAG工作流中，提高了性能和效率。
AI.motivation: 解决当前基于图的RAG方法在图结构设计上的不足，这些不足阻碍了图算法的整合，导致工作流不一致和性能下降。
AI.method: 提出NodeRAG框架，利用异构图结构，紧密对齐LLM的能力，实现端到端的高效流程。
AI.result: 实验显示NodeRAG在索引时间、查询时间、存储效率及问答性能上优于GraphRAG和LightRAG。
AI.conclusion: NodeRAG通过优化图结构设计，释放了图在RAG中的潜力，为特定领域提供了事实一致的回答。

title: Steering Prosocial AI Agents: Computational Basis of LLM's Decision Making in Social Simulation
abstract: Large language models (LLMs) increasingly serve as human-like decision-making agents in social science and applied settings. These LLM-agents are typically assigned human-like characters and placed in real-life contexts. However, how these characters and contexts shape an LLM's behavior remains underexplored. This study proposes and tests methods for probing, quantifying, and modifying an LLM's internal representations in a Dictator Game -- a classic behavioral experiment on fairness and prosocial behavior. We extract ``vectors of variable variations'' (e.g., ``male'' to ``female'') from the LLM's internal state. Manipulating these vectors during the model's inference can substantially alter how those variables relate to the model's decision-making. This approach offers a principled way to study and regulate how social concepts can be encoded and engineered within transformer-based models, with implications for alignment, debiasing, and designing AI agents for social simulations in both academic and commercial applications.
subjects: Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Computers and Society (cs.CY); Machine Learning (cs.LG); General Economics (econ.GN)

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了大型语言模型（LLMs）在社交科学和应用设置中作为类似人类的决策代理的行为，特别是在Dictator Game中，提出了探测、量化和修改LLM内部表示的方法，以研究社会概念如何在基于变压器的模型中被编码和设计。
AI.motivation: 随着大型语言模型越来越多地作为类似人类的决策代理在社交科学和应用设置中使用，这些LLM代理通常被赋予人类特征并置于现实生活情境中。然而，这些特征和情境如何塑造LLM的行为仍未被充分探索。
AI.method: 研究提出并测试了在Dictator Game中探测、量化和修改LLM内部表示的方法，通过提取“变量变化向量”（如“男性”到“女性”）并在模型推理过程中操纵这些向量，来改变这些变量与模型决策之间的关系。
AI.result: 研究发现，操纵这些向量可以显著改变这些变量与模型决策之间的关系，为研究社会概念如何在基于变压器的模型中被编码和设计提供了一种原则性的方法。
AI.conclusion: 这种方法为研究和管理社会概念在基于变压器的模型中的编码和工程设计提供了一种原则性的方法，对于对齐、去偏见以及设计用于学术和商业应用中社交模拟的AI代理具有重要意义。

title: A Library of LLM Intrinsics for Retrieval-Augmented Generation
abstract: In the developer community for large language models (LLMs), there is not yet a clean pattern analogous to a software library, to support very large scale collaboration. Even for the commonplace use case of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), it is not currently possible to write a RAG application against a well-defined set of APIs that are agreed upon by different LLM providers. Inspired by the idea of compiler intrinsics, we propose some elements of such a concept through introducing a library of LLM Intrinsics for RAG. An LLM intrinsic is defined as a capability that can be invoked through a well-defined API that is reasonably stable and independent of how the LLM intrinsic itself is implemented. The intrinsics in our library are released as LoRA adapters on HuggingFace, and through a software interface with clear structured input/output characteristics on top of vLLM as an inference platform, accompanied in both places with documentation and code. This article describes the intended usage, training details, and evaluations for each intrinsic, as well as compositions of multiple intrinsics.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种为检索增强生成（RAG）设计的LLM内部功能库，旨在通过定义清晰的API支持大规模协作开发，类似于编译器内部功能的概念。
AI.motivation: 解决大型语言模型（LLM）开发社区中缺乏类似软件库的清晰模式来支持大规模协作的问题，特别是在检索增强生成（RAG）应用中缺乏统一的API定义。
AI.method: 通过引入LLM内部功能库，定义可以通过清晰API调用的能力，这些API实现与具体实现方式无关。库中的内部功能以LoRA适配器形式在HuggingFace上发布，并通过vLLM作为推理平台的软件接口提供。
AI.result: 开发了一个包含多个内部功能的库，每个功能都有明确的输入/输出特性、文档和代码支持，支持单个或多个内部功能的组合使用。
AI.conclusion: 提出的LLM内部功能库为RAG应用提供了一种标准化、可协作的开发模式，有望促进LLM开发社区的大规模协作和创新。

title: Shared Disk KV Cache Management for Efficient Multi-Instance Inference in RAG-Powered LLMs
abstract: Recent large language models (LLMs) face increasing inference latency as input context length and model size continue to grow. In particular, the retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) technique, which enhances LLM responses by incorporating external knowledge, exacerbates this issue by significantly increasing the number of input tokens. This expansion in token length leads to a substantial rise in computational overhead, particularly during the prefill stage, resulting in prolonged time-to-first-token (TTFT). To address this issue, this paper proposes a method to reduce TTFT by leveraging a disk-based key-value (KV) cache to lessen the computational burden during the prefill stage. We also introduce a disk-based shared KV cache management system, called Shared RAG-DCache, for multi-instance LLM RAG service environments. This system, together with an optimal system configuration, improves both throughput and latency under given resource constraints. Shared RAG-DCache exploits the locality of documents related to user queries in RAG, as well as the queueing delay in LLM inference services. It proactively generates and stores disk KV caches for query-related documents and shares them across multiple LLM instances to enhance inference performance. In experiments on a single host equipped with 2 GPUs and 1 CPU, Shared RAG-DCache achieved a 15~71% increase in throughput and up to a 12~65% reduction in latency, depending on the resource configuration.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Shared RAG-DCache的磁盘键值缓存管理系统，旨在减少RAG增强的大型语言模型（LLMs）推理时的首次令牌时间（TTFT），通过共享磁盘KV缓存和多实例管理，提高了吞吐量和降低了延迟。
AI.motivation: 随着输入上下文长度和模型大小的增加，大型语言模型（LLMs）的推理延迟问题日益严重，特别是采用检索增强生成（RAG）技术时，输入令牌数量的显著增加导致预填充阶段的计算开销大幅上升，延长了首次令牌时间（TTFT）。
AI.method: 提出了一种利用磁盘键值（KV）缓存减轻预填充阶段计算负担的方法，并引入了名为Shared RAG-DCache的磁盘共享KV缓存管理系统，该系统通过利用RAG中用户查询相关文档的局部性和LLM推理服务中的排队延迟，主动生成和存储查询相关文档的磁盘KV缓存，并在多个LLM实例间共享以提高推理性能。
AI.result: 在配备2个GPU和1个CPU的单台主机上进行的实验中，Shared RAG-DCache实现了吞吐量15~71%的提升和延迟12~65%的降低，具体效果取决于资源配置。
AI.conclusion: Shared RAG-DCache系统通过优化系统配置和共享磁盘KV缓存，有效提高了RAG增强的LLMs在多实例服务环境下的推理性能，为减少TTFT和提高系统效率提供了可行的解决方案。

title: Towards LLM Agents for Earth Observation
abstract: Earth Observation (EO) provides critical planetary data for environmental monitoring, disaster management, climate science, and other scientific domains. Here we ask: Are AI systems ready for reliable Earth Observation? We introduce \datasetnamenospace, a benchmark of 140 yes/no questions from NASA Earth Observatory articles across 13 topics and 17 satellite sensors. Using Google Earth Engine API as a tool, LLM agents can only achieve an accuracy of 33% because the code fails to run over 58% of the time. We improve the failure rate for open models by fine-tuning synthetic data, allowing much smaller models (Llama-3.1-8B) to achieve comparable accuracy to much larger ones (e.g., DeepSeek-R1). Taken together, our findings identify significant challenges to be solved before AI agents can automate earth observation, and suggest paths forward. The project page is available at

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了AI系统在地球观测（EO）领域的可靠性，介绍了\datasetnamenospace基准测试，包含来自NASA地球观测文章的140个是/否问题，覆盖13个主题和17个卫星传感器。研究发现，使用Google Earth Engine API的LLM代理仅能达到33%的准确率，且代码运行失败率超过58%。通过微调合成数据，较小的模型（如Llama-3.1-8B）可以达到与较大模型（如DeepSeek-R1）相当的准确率。研究指出了AI代理自动化地球观测前需解决的主要挑战，并提出了前进路径。
AI.motivation: 解决AI系统在地球观测领域的可靠性问题，评估当前AI代理在处理地球观测数据时的表现，并提出改进方法。
AI.method: 引入\datasetnamenospace基准测试，使用Google Earth Engine API作为工具，评估LLM代理的性能，并通过微调合成数据改进较小模型的性能。
AI.result: LLM代理在基准测试中的准确率仅为33%，代码运行失败率超过58%。通过微调合成数据，较小模型可以达到与较大模型相当的准确率。
AI.conclusion: 研究揭示了AI代理自动化地球观测面临的主要挑战，通过微调合成数据可以提升较小模型的性能，为未来的研究和发展提供了方向。

title: Perceptions of Agentic AI in Organizations: Implications for Responsible AI and ROI
abstract: As artificial intelligence (AI) systems rapidly gain autonomy, the need for robust responsible AI frameworks becomes paramount. This paper investigates how organizations perceive and adapt such frameworks amidst the emerging landscape of increasingly sophisticated agentic AI. Employing an interpretive qualitative approach, the study explores the lived experiences of AI professionals. Findings highlight that the inherent complexity of agentic AI systems and their responsible implementation, rooted in the intricate interconnectedness of responsible AI dimensions and the thematic framework (an analytical structure developed from the data), combined with the novelty of agentic AI, contribute to significant challenges in organizational adaptation, characterized by knowledge gaps, a limited emphasis on stakeholder engagement, and a strong focus on control. These factors, by hindering effective adaptation and implementation, ultimately compromise the potential for responsible AI and the realization of ROI.

AI.tldr: 随着人工智能（AI）系统自主性的迅速增强，建立强大的负责任AI框架变得至关重要。本文探讨了组织如何在日益复杂的代理AI新兴领域中感知和适应这些框架。
AI.motivation: 解决组织在实施负责任AI框架时面临的挑战，特别是由于代理AI系统的复杂性和新颖性所带来的问题。
AI.method: 采用解释性定性方法，研究AI专业人士的实际经验。
AI.result: 研究发现，代理AI系统的固有复杂性及其负责任实施的复杂性，加上代理AI的新颖性，导致组织适应过程中出现知识缺口、对利益相关者参与的重视不足以及对控制的强烈关注等重大挑战。
AI.conclusion: 这些因素通过阻碍有效的适应和实施，最终损害了负责任AI的潜力和投资回报率（ROI）的实现。

title: Achieving Tighter Finite-Time Rates for Heterogeneous Federated Stochastic Approximation under Markovian Sampling
abstract: Motivated by collaborative reinforcement learning (RL) and optimization with time-correlated data, we study a generic federated stochastic approximation problem involving $M$ agents, where each agent is characterized by an agent-specific (potentially nonlinear) local operator. The goal is for the agents to communicate intermittently via a server to find the root of the average of the agents' local operators. The generality of our setting stems from allowing for (i) Markovian data at each agent and (ii) heterogeneity in the roots of the agents' local operators. The limited recent work that has accounted for both these features in a federated setting fails to guarantee convergence to the desired point or to show any benefit of collaboration; furthermore, they rely on projection steps in their algorithms to guarantee bounded iterates. Our work overcomes each of these limitations. We develop a novel algorithm titled \texttt{FedHSA}, and prove that it guarantees convergence to the correct point, while enjoying an $M$-fold linear speedup in sample-complexity due to collaboration. To our knowledge, \emph{this is the first finite-time result of its kind}, and establishing it (without relying on a projection step) entails a fairly intricate argument that accounts for the interplay between complex temporal correlations due to Markovian sampling, multiple local steps to save communication, and the drift-effects induced by heterogeneous local operators. Our results have implications for a broad class of heterogeneous federated RL problems (e.g., policy evaluation and control) with function approximation, where the agents' Markov decision processes can differ in their probability transition kernels and reward functions.
subjects: Machine Learning (cs.LG); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Systems and Control (eess.SY); Optimization and Control (math.OC)

AI.tldr: 本文研究了一个涉及M个代理的通用联邦随机逼近问题，旨在通过间歇性通信找到代理本地操作平均值的根。提出了一种新算法FedHSA，证明了其正确收敛性，并展示了协作带来的样本复杂度线性加速。
AI.motivation: 解决在马尔可夫采样和异构本地操作根下的联邦随机逼近问题，克服现有工作中无法保证收敛或协作优势的局限。
AI.method: 开发了FedHSA算法，无需投影步骤，考虑了马尔可夫采样的时间相关性、多本地步骤节省通信及异构本地操作引起的漂移效应。
AI.result: FedHSA算法保证了正确收敛，并实现了M倍的样本复杂度线性加速，这是此类问题的首个有限时间结果。
AI.conclusion: 研究成果对一类广泛的异构联邦强化学习问题（如策略评估和控制）具有重要影响，特别是在代理的马尔可夫决策过程在概率转移核和奖励函数上不同的情况下。

title: Progent: Programmable Privilege Control for LLM Agents
abstract: LLM agents are an emerging form of AI systems where large language models (LLMs) serve as the central component, utilizing a diverse set of tools to complete user-assigned tasks. Despite their great potential, LLM agents pose significant security risks. When interacting with the external world, they may encounter malicious commands from attackers, leading to the execution of dangerous actions. A promising way to address this is by enforcing the principle of least privilege: allowing only essential actions for task completion while blocking unnecessary ones. However, achieving this is challenging, as it requires covering diverse agent scenarios while preserving both security and utility.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Progent的方法，旨在为LLM代理提供可编程的权限控制，以解决其在执行任务时可能遇到的安全风险。
AI.motivation: LLM代理作为一种新兴的AI系统，虽然潜力巨大，但在与外部世界交互时可能面临恶意命令的攻击，导致执行危险动作。本文旨在通过实施最小权限原则来解决这一问题。
AI.method: Progent方法通过可编程的权限控制机制，允许仅执行完成任务所必需的动作，同时阻止不必要的动作，以覆盖多样化的代理场景，同时保持安全和实用性。
AI.result: Progent方法能够有效减少LLM代理在执行任务时的安全风险，通过精确控制权限，既保护了系统安全，又不牺牲其功能性。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出的Progent方法为LLM代理的安全管理提供了一种有效的解决方案，通过实施最小权限原则，能够在多样化的应用场景中平衡安全与实用性。

title: Causality-enhanced Decision-Making for Autonomous Mobile Robots in Dynamic Environments
abstract: The growing integration of robots in shared environments -- such as warehouses, shopping centres, and hospitals -- demands a deep understanding of the underlying dynamics and human behaviours, including how, when, and where individuals engage in various activities and interactions. This knowledge goes beyond simple correlation studies and requires a more comprehensive causal analysis. By leveraging causal inference to model cause-and-effect relationships, we can better anticipate critical environmental factors and enable autonomous robots to plan and execute tasks more effectively. To this end, we propose a novel causality-based decision-making framework that reasons over a learned causal model to predict battery usage and human obstructions, understanding how these factors could influence robot task execution. Such reasoning framework assists the robot in deciding when and how to complete a given task. To achieve this, we developed also PeopleFlow, a new Gazebo-based simulator designed to model context-sensitive human-robot spatial interactions in shared workspaces. PeopleFlow features realistic human and robot trajectories influenced by contextual factors such as time, environment layout, and robot state, and can simulate a large number of agents. While the simulator is general-purpose, in this paper we focus on a warehouse-like environment as a case study, where we conduct an extensive evaluation benchmarking our causal approach against a non-causal baseline. Our findings demonstrate the efficacy of the proposed solutions, highlighting how causal reasoning enables autonomous robots to operate more efficiently and safely in dynamic environments shared with humans.
comments: Under review at The International Journal of Robotics Research (IJRR)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于因果推理的决策框架，旨在通过学习和利用因果模型来预测电池使用和人类障碍，从而帮助自主机器人在动态环境中更高效、更安全地执行任务。
AI.motivation: 随着机器人在共享环境（如仓库、购物中心和医院）中的集成日益增多，需要超越简单的相关性研究，进行更全面的因果分析，以更好地理解环境动态和人类行为，从而优化机器人的任务执行。
AI.method: 开发了一个名为PeopleFlow的新Gazebo模拟器，用于模拟上下文敏感的人机空间交互，并提出了一个基于因果推理的决策框架，该框架通过学习的因果模型来预测影响机器人任务执行的关键因素。
AI.result: 在类似仓库的环境中进行的大量评估表明，与无因果基线相比，提出的因果方法能够使自主机器人在与人类共享的动态环境中更高效、更安全地操作。
AI.conclusion: 因果推理为自主机器人在动态和共享环境中的决策提供了显著优势，不仅提高了任务执行的效率，还增强了安全性。

title: ARCeR: an Agentic RAG for the Automated Definition of Cyber Ranges
abstract: The growing and evolving landscape of cybersecurity threats necessitates the development of supporting tools and platforms that allow for the creation of realistic IT environments operating within virtual, controlled settings as Cyber Ranges (CRs). CRs can be exploited for analyzing vulnerabilities and experimenting with the effectiveness of devised countermeasures, as well as serving as training environments for building cyber security skills and abilities for IT operators. This paper proposes ARCeR as an innovative solution for the automatic generation and deployment of CRs, starting from user-provided descriptions in a natural language. ARCeR relies on the Agentic RAG paradigm, which allows it to fully exploit state-of-art AI technologies. Experimental results show that ARCeR is able to successfully process prompts even in cases that LLMs or basic RAG systems are not able to cope with. Furthermore, ARCeR is able to target any CR framework provided that specific knowledge is made available to it.

AI.tldr: ARCeR是一种基于Agentic RAG范式的创新解决方案，用于从用户提供的自然语言描述中自动生成和部署网络靶场（Cyber Ranges，CRs）。
AI.motivation: 网络安全威胁的不断增长和演变需要开发支持工具和平台，以创建在虚拟、受控环境中运行的现实IT环境作为网络靶场。
AI.method: ARCeR依赖于Agentic RAG范式，充分利用了最先进的AI技术。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，ARCeR能够成功处理即使在大型语言模型（LLMs）或基本RAG系统无法应对的情况下也能处理的提示。
AI.conclusion: ARCeR能够针对任何网络靶场框架，只要为其提供特定的知识，展示了其在自动生成和部署网络靶场方面的有效性和灵活性。

title: Communication Optimization for Decentralized Learning atop Bandwidth-limited Edge Networks
abstract: Decentralized federated learning (DFL) is a promising machine learning paradigm for bringing artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities to the network edge. Running DFL on top of edge networks, however, faces severe performance challenges due to the extensive parameter exchanges between agents. Most existing solutions for these challenges were based on simplistic communication models, which cannot capture the case of learning over a multi-hop bandwidth-limited network. In this work, we address this problem by jointly designing the communication scheme for the overlay network formed by the agents and the mixing matrix that controls the communication demands between the agents. By carefully analyzing the properties of our problem, we cast each design problem into a tractable optimization and develop an efficient algorithm with guaranteed performance. Our evaluations based on real topology and data show that the proposed algorithm can reduce the total training time by over $80\%$ compared to the baseline without sacrificing accuracy, while significantly improving the computational efficiency over the state of the art.
subjects: Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC); Machine Learning (cs.LG)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种在带宽有限的边缘网络上优化去中心化联邦学习（DFL）通信的方法，通过联合设计代理之间的覆盖网络通信方案和混合矩阵，显著减少了训练时间。
AI.motivation: 去中心化联邦学习（DFL）在边缘网络上的运行面临着由于代理之间大量参数交换导致的性能挑战。现有解决方案基于简化的通信模型，无法捕捉在多跳带宽有限网络上学习的情况。
AI.method: 通过分析问题的特性，将每个设计问题转化为可处理的优化问题，并开发了一种保证性能的高效算法。
AI.result: 基于真实拓扑和数据的评估显示，所提出的算法可以将总训练时间减少超过80%，同时不牺牲准确性，并显著提高了计算效率。
AI.conclusion: 本研究为在带宽有限的边缘网络上高效运行去中心化联邦学习提供了一种有效的通信优化方法，显著提升了训练效率和计算性能。

title: GrabS: Generative Embodied Agent for 3D Object Segmentation without Scene Supervision
abstract: We study the hard problem of 3D object segmentation in complex point clouds without requiring human labels of 3D scenes for supervision. By relying on the similarity of pretrained 2D features or external signals such as motion to group 3D points as objects, existing unsupervised methods are usually limited to identifying simple objects like cars or their segmented objects are often inferior due to the lack of objectness in pretrained features. In this paper, we propose a new two-stage pipeline called GrabS. The core concept of our method is to learn generative and discriminative object-centric priors as a foundation from object datasets in the first stage, and then design an embodied agent to learn to discover multiple objects by querying against the pretrained generative priors in the second stage. We extensively evaluate our method on two real-world datasets and a newly created synthetic dataset, demonstrating remarkable segmentation performance, clearly surpassing all existing unsupervised methods.
subjects: Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Machine Learning (cs.LG); Robotics (cs.RO)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为GrabS的两阶段流程，用于无需场景监督的3D对象分割，通过生成和区分对象中心先验学习，显著提升了分割性能。
AI.motivation: 解决在复杂点云中进行3D对象分割的难题，无需人类标注的3D场景监督，克服现有无监督方法在识别简单对象或分割质量上的限制。
AI.method: 首先从对象数据集中学习生成和区分对象中心先验，然后设计一个体现代理通过查询预训练的生成先验来发现多个对象。
AI.result: 在两个真实世界数据集和一个新创建的合成数据集上进行了广泛评估，展示了显著的分割性能，明显超越所有现有的无监督方法。
AI.conclusion: GrabS方法通过学习对象中心先验和体现代理的查询机制，有效地解决了无监督3D对象分割的问题，为未来的研究提供了新的方向。

title: Enhancing Autonomous Driving Systems with On-Board Deployed Large Language Models
abstract: Neural Networks (NNs) trained through supervised learning struggle with managing edge-case scenarios common in real-world driving due to the intractability of exhaustive datasets covering all edge-cases, making knowledge-driven approaches, akin to how humans intuitively detect unexpected driving behavior, a suitable complement to data-driven methods. This work proposes a hybrid architecture combining low-level Model Predictive Controller (MPC) with locally deployed Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance decision-making and Human Machine Interaction (HMI). The DecisionxLLM module evaluates robotic state information against natural language instructions to ensure adherence to desired driving behavior. The MPCxLLM module then adjusts MPC parameters based on LLM-generated insights, achieving control adaptability while preserving the safety and constraint guarantees of traditional MPC systems. Further, to enable efficient on-board deployment and to eliminate dependency on cloud connectivity, we shift processing to the on-board computing platform: We propose an approach that exploits Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), Low Rank Adaptation (LoRA) fine-tuning, and quantization. Experimental results demonstrate that these enhancements yield significant improvements in reasoning accuracy by up to 10.45%, control adaptability by as much as 52.2%, and up to 10.5x increase in computational efficiency (tokens/s), validating the proposed framework's practicality for real-time deployment even on down-scaled robotic platforms. This work bridges high-level decision-making with low-level control adaptability, offering a synergistic framework for knowledge-driven and adaptive Autonomous Driving Systems (ADS).

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种结合低级模型预测控制器（MPC）和本地部署的大型语言模型（LLMs）的混合架构，以增强自动驾驶系统的决策制定和人机交互（HMI）。通过决策xLLM和MPCxLLM模块，以及采用RAG、LoRA微调和量化技术，实现了在车载计算平台上的高效部署，显著提高了推理准确性、控制适应性和计算效率。
AI.motivation: 解决传统神经网络在监督学习训练下难以处理现实驾驶中边缘案例的问题，通过知识驱动的方法补充数据驱动方法的不足。
AI.method: 提出了一种混合架构，结合了MPC和本地部署的LLMs，利用RAG、LoRA微调和量化技术实现高效车载部署。
AI.result: 实验结果显示，推理准确性提高了10.45%，控制适应性提高了52.2%，计算效率提高了10.5倍。
AI.conclusion: 该工作通过将高级决策制定与低级控制适应性相结合，为知识驱动和自适应的自动驾驶系统提供了一个协同框架。

title: A Visual RAG Pipeline for Few-Shot Fine-Grained Product Classification
abstract: Despite the rapid evolution of learning and computer vision algorithms, Fine-Grained Classification (FGC) still poses an open problem in many practically relevant applications. In the retail domain, for example, the identification of fast changing and visually highly similar products and their properties are key to automated price-monitoring and product recommendation. This paper presents a novel Visual RAG pipeline that combines the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) approach and Vision Language Models (VLMs) for few-shot FGC. This Visual RAG pipeline extracts product and promotion data in advertisement leaflets from various retailers and simultaneously predicts fine-grained product ids along with price and discount information. Compared to previous approaches, the key characteristic of the Visual RAG pipeline is that it allows the prediction of novel products without re-training, simply by adding a few class samples to the RAG database. Comparing several VLM back-ends like GPT-4o [23], GPT-4o-mini [24], and Gemini 2.0 Flash [10], our approach achieves 86.8% accuracy on a diverse dataset.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新颖的Visual RAG管道，结合了检索增强生成（RAG）方法和视觉语言模型（VLMs），用于少样本细粒度分类（FGC），在零售领域的广告传单中提取产品和促销数据，并预测细粒度产品ID及价格和折扣信息。
AI.motivation: 解决细粒度分类（FGC）在零售领域中的挑战，如快速变化和视觉上高度相似的产品及其属性的识别，这对于自动化价格监控和产品推荐至关重要。
AI.method: 采用Visual RAG管道，结合RAG方法和VLMs，无需重新训练即可预测新产品，只需向RAG数据库添加少量类样本。
AI.result: 在多种VLM后端（如GPT-4o、GPT-4o-mini和Gemini 2.0 Flash）的比较中，该方法在多样化数据集上达到了86.8%的准确率。
AI.conclusion: Visual RAG管道为少样本细粒度产品分类提供了一种有效的解决方案，能够在不重新训练的情况下预测新产品，具有重要的实际应用价值。

title: REAL: Benchmarking Autonomous Agents on Deterministic Simulations of Real Websites
abstract: We introduce REAL, a benchmark and framework for multi-turn agent evaluations on deterministic simulations of real-world websites. REAL comprises high-fidelity, deterministic replicas of 11 widely-used websites across domains such as e-commerce, travel, communication, and professional networking. We also release a benchmark consisting of 112 practical tasks that mirror everyday complex user interactions requiring both accurate information retrieval and state-changing actions. All interactions occur within this fully controlled setting, eliminating safety risks and enabling robust, reproducible evaluation of agent capability and reliability. Our novel evaluation framework combines programmatic checks of website state for action-based tasks with rubric-guided LLM-based judgments for information retrieval. The framework supports both open-source and proprietary agent systems through a flexible evaluation harness that accommodates black-box commands within browser environments, allowing research labs to test agentic systems without modification. Our empirical results show that frontier language models achieve at most a 41% success rate on REAL, highlighting critical gaps in autonomous web navigation and task completion capabilities. Our framework supports easy integration of new tasks, reproducible evaluation, and scalable data generation for training web agents. The websites, framework, and leaderboard are available at

AI.tldr: REAL是一个用于多轮代理评估的基准和框架，基于真实网站的高保真确定性模拟。它包括11个广泛使用的网站的复制品，涵盖电子商务、旅行、通信和专业网络等领域，并发布了112个反映日常复杂用户交互的任务。
AI.motivation: 解决在安全、可控环境中评估自主代理在真实网站上的导航和任务完成能力的问题，以及当前代理在这些任务上的表现不足。
AI.method: 创建高保真、确定性的真实网站模拟，结合程序化检查和基于LLM的评判，支持开源和专有代理系统的灵活评估。
AI.result: 前沿语言模型在REAL上的成功率最高仅为41%，揭示了自主网络导航和任务完成能力的重大差距。
AI.conclusion: REAL框架为评估和训练网络代理提供了可扩展、可重复的解决方案，支持新任务的轻松集成和数据的生成。

title: NodeRAG: Structuring Graph-based RAG with Heterogeneous Nodes
abstract: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) empowers large language models to access external and private corpus, enabling factually consistent responses in specific domains. By exploiting the inherent structure of the corpus, graph-based RAG methods further enrich this process by building a knowledge graph index and leveraging the structural nature of graphs. However, current graph-based RAG approaches seldom prioritize the design of graph structures. Inadequately designed graph not only impede the seamless integration of diverse graph algorithms but also result in workflow inconsistencies and degraded performance. To further unleash the potential of graph for RAG, we propose NodeRAG, a graph-centric framework introducing heterogeneous graph structures that enable the seamless and holistic integration of graph-based methodologies into the RAG workflow. By aligning closely with the capabilities of LLMs, this framework ensures a fully cohesive and efficient end-to-end process. Through extensive experiments, we demonstrate that NodeRAG exhibits performance advantages over previous methods, including GraphRAG and LightRAG, not only in indexing time, query time, and storage efficiency but also in delivering superior question-answering performance on multi-hop benchmarks and open-ended head-to-head evaluations with minimal retrieval tokens. Our GitHub repository could be seen at

AI.tldr: NodeRAG是一个图中心框架，通过引入异构图结构，将基于图的方法无缝且整体地集成到RAG工作流程中，以提高性能和效率。
AI.motivation: 解决当前基于图的RAG方法在图结构设计上的不足，这些不足阻碍了多样图算法的无缝集成，导致工作流程不一致和性能下降。
AI.method: 提出NodeRAG框架，引入异构图结构，紧密对齐LLM的能力，确保一个完全内聚和高效的端到端过程。
AI.result: 通过大量实验证明，NodeRAG在索引时间、查询时间、存储效率以及在多跳基准和开放式头对头评估中的问答性能上优于先前的方法。
AI.conclusion: NodeRAG通过优化图结构设计，释放了图在RAG中的潜力，提供了性能优势和更高的效率。

title: GraphicBench: A Planning Benchmark for Graphic Design with Language Agents
abstract: Large Language Model (LLM)-powered agents have unlocked new possibilities for automating human tasks. While prior work has focused on well-defined tasks with specified goals, the capabilities of agents in creative design tasks with open-ended goals remain underexplored. We introduce GraphicBench, a new planning benchmark for graphic design that covers 1,079 user queries and input images across four design types. We further present GraphicTown, an LLM agent framework with three design experts and 46 actions (tools) to choose from for executing each step of the planned workflows in web environments. Experiments with six LLMs demonstrate their ability to generate workflows that integrate both explicit design constraints from user queries and implicit commonsense constraints. However, these workflows often do not lead to successful execution outcomes, primarily due to challenges in: (1) reasoning about spatial relationships, (2) coordinating global dependencies across experts, and (3) retrieving the most appropriate action per step. We envision GraphicBench as a challenging yet valuable testbed for advancing LLM-agent planning and execution in creative design tasks.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了GraphicBench，一个为语言代理设计的图形设计规划基准，包含1,079个用户查询和输入图像，覆盖四种设计类型。并提出了GraphicTown，一个LLM代理框架，用于在网页环境中执行规划的工作流程。实验表明，LLM能生成整合显式和隐式约束的工作流程，但在执行中面临空间关系推理、全局依赖协调和动作选择等挑战。
AI.motivation: 探索大型语言模型（LLM）代理在具有开放目标的创意设计任务中的能力，填补了现有研究在明确目标任务之外的空白。
AI.method: 引入GraphicBench基准和GraphicTown框架，后者包含三个设计专家和46个动作（工具），用于在网页环境中执行规划的工作流程。
AI.result: 实验显示，LLM能够生成整合用户查询中的显式设计约束和常识性隐式约束的工作流程，但在执行过程中遇到空间关系推理、全局依赖协调和动作选择等主要挑战。
AI.conclusion: GraphicBench作为一个具有挑战性但有价值的测试平台，有助于推进LLM代理在创意设计任务中的规划和执行能力。

title: Steering Prosocial AI Agents: Computational Basis of LLM's Decision Making in Social Simulation
abstract: Large language models (LLMs) increasingly serve as human-like decision-making agents in social science and applied settings. These LLM-agents are typically assigned human-like characters and placed in real-life contexts. However, how these characters and contexts shape an LLM's behavior remains underexplored. This study proposes and tests methods for probing, quantifying, and modifying an LLM's internal representations in a Dictator Game -- a classic behavioral experiment on fairness and prosocial behavior. We extract ``vectors of variable variations'' (e.g., ``male'' to ``female'') from the LLM's internal state. Manipulating these vectors during the model's inference can substantially alter how those variables relate to the model's decision-making. This approach offers a principled way to study and regulate how social concepts can be encoded and engineered within transformer-based models, with implications for alignment, debiasing, and designing AI agents for social simulations in both academic and commercial applications.
subjects: Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Computers and Society (cs.CY); Machine Learning (cs.LG); General Economics (econ.GN)

AI.tldr: 本文研究了大型语言模型（LLMs）在社会科学和应用设置中作为人类类似决策代理的行为，特别是在独裁者游戏中如何通过操纵其内部表示来调整其决策行为。
AI.motivation: 探讨LLMs在模拟人类决策时，其行为和决策如何受到角色和情境的影响，以及如何量化和修改这些影响。
AI.method: 提出并测试了从LLM内部状态提取“变量变化向量”（如“男性”到“女性”）的方法，并在模型推理过程中操纵这些向量。
AI.result: 通过操纵这些向量，可以显著改变这些变量与模型决策之间的关系。
AI.conclusion: 这种方法为研究和调节基于变压器的模型中社会概念的编码和工程设计提供了一种原则性方法，对对齐、去偏见以及设计用于学术和商业应用的社交模拟AI代理具有重要意义。

title: A Library of LLM Intrinsics for Retrieval-Augmented Generation
abstract: In the developer community for large language models (LLMs), there is not yet a clean pattern analogous to a software library, to support very large scale collaboration. Even for the commonplace use case of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), it is not currently possible to write a RAG application against a well-defined set of APIs that are agreed upon by different LLM providers. Inspired by the idea of compiler intrinsics, we propose some elements of such a concept through introducing a library of LLM Intrinsics for RAG. An LLM intrinsic is defined as a capability that can be invoked through a well-defined API that is reasonably stable and independent of how the LLM intrinsic itself is implemented. The intrinsics in our library are released as LoRA adapters on HuggingFace, and through a software interface with clear structured input/output characteristics on top of vLLM as an inference platform, accompanied in both places with documentation and code. This article describes the intended usage, training details, and evaluations for each intrinsic, as well as compositions of multiple intrinsics.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种为检索增强生成（RAG）设计的LLM内部功能库，旨在通过定义良好的API支持大规模协作，类似于编译器内部功能的概念。
AI.motivation: 解决大型语言模型（LLM）开发者社区中缺乏类似于软件库的清晰模式来支持大规模协作的问题，特别是在检索增强生成（RAG）应用开发中缺乏统一API的问题。
AI.method: 通过引入LLM内部功能库，定义可以通过定义良好且稳定的API调用的能力，这些内部功能以LoRA适配器形式在HuggingFace上发布，并通过vLLM作为推理平台的软件接口提供。
AI.result: 发布了包含文档和代码的LLM内部功能库，支持RAG应用的开发，并提供了每种内部功能的预期用途、训练细节和评估，以及多内部功能的组合使用。
AI.conclusion: 通过LLM内部功能库的引入，为LLM开发者社区提供了一个支持大规模协作和统一API调用的解决方案，特别是在RAG应用开发中。

title: Shared Disk KV Cache Management for Efficient Multi-Instance Inference in RAG-Powered LLMs
abstract: Recent large language models (LLMs) face increasing inference latency as input context length and model size continue to grow. In particular, the retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) technique, which enhances LLM responses by incorporating external knowledge, exacerbates this issue by significantly increasing the number of input tokens. This expansion in token length leads to a substantial rise in computational overhead, particularly during the prefill stage, resulting in prolonged time-to-first-token (TTFT). To address this issue, this paper proposes a method to reduce TTFT by leveraging a disk-based key-value (KV) cache to lessen the computational burden during the prefill stage. We also introduce a disk-based shared KV cache management system, called Shared RAG-DCache, for multi-instance LLM RAG service environments. This system, together with an optimal system configuration, improves both throughput and latency under given resource constraints. Shared RAG-DCache exploits the locality of documents related to user queries in RAG, as well as the queueing delay in LLM inference services. It proactively generates and stores disk KV caches for query-related documents and shares them across multiple LLM instances to enhance inference performance. In experiments on a single host equipped with 2 GPUs and 1 CPU, Shared RAG-DCache achieved a 15~71% increase in throughput and up to a 12~65% reduction in latency, depending on the resource configuration.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于磁盘的共享键值（KV）缓存管理系统Shared RAG-DCache，用于减少检索增强生成（RAG）技术中大型语言模型（LLMs）的推理延迟，特别是在预填充阶段的计算负担，从而缩短首次令牌时间（TTFT）。通过在多实例LLM RAG服务环境中共享磁盘KV缓存，该系统在给定资源约束下提高了吞吐量和降低了延迟。
AI.motivation: 随着输入上下文长度和模型大小的增加，大型语言模型（LLMs）的推理延迟问题日益突出。特别是检索增强生成（RAG）技术通过整合外部知识来增强LLM响应，显著增加了输入令牌的数量，从而在预填充阶段增加了计算开销，导致首次令牌时间（TTFT）延长。
AI.method: 本文提出了一种利用磁盘键值（KV）缓存来减轻预填充阶段计算负担的方法，并引入了一个磁盘共享KV缓存管理系统Shared RAG-DCache。该系统利用RAG中与用户查询相关的文档的局部性以及LLM推理服务中的排队延迟，主动生成并存储查询相关文档的磁盘KV缓存，并在多个LLM实例之间共享这些缓存以提高推理性能。
AI.result: 在配备2个GPU和1个CPU的单台主机上进行的实验中，Shared RAG-DCache实现了吞吐量15~71%的提升和延迟12~65%的降低，具体效果取决于资源配置。
AI.conclusion: Shared RAG-DCache系统通过在多实例LLM RAG服务环境中共享磁盘KV缓存，有效提高了推理性能，为减少大型语言模型在检索增强生成技术中的推理延迟提供了可行的解决方案。

title: Evaluating the Goal-Directedness of Large Language Models
abstract: To what extent do LLMs use their capabilities towards their given goal? We take this as a measure of their goal-directedness. We evaluate goal-directedness on tasks that require information gathering, cognitive effort, and plan execution, where we use subtasks to infer each model's relevant capabilities. Our evaluations of LLMs from Google DeepMind, OpenAI, and Anthropic show that goal-directedness is relatively consistent across tasks, differs from task performance, and is only moderately sensitive to motivational prompts. Notably, most models are not fully goal-directed. We hope our goal-directedness evaluations will enable better monitoring of LLM progress, and enable more deliberate design choices of agentic properties in LLMs.
subjects: Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Computation and Language (cs.CL); Machine Learning (cs.LG)

AI.tldr: 评估大型语言模型（LLMs）在给定目标下的目标导向性程度，通过信息收集、认知努力和计划执行等任务进行测试。
AI.motivation: 解决LLMs在其能力范围内对给定目标的使用程度问题，即目标导向性的评估。
AI.method: 通过在需要信息收集、认知努力和计划执行的任务上评估LLMs，使用子任务来推断每个模型的相关能力。
AI.result: 评估显示，目标导向性在不同任务间相对一致，与任务表现不同，且对动机提示的敏感度适中。大多数模型并非完全目标导向。
AI.conclusion: 目标导向性评估有助于更好地监控LLMs的进展，并更审慎地设计LLMs的代理属性。

title: Enhancing Web Agents with Explicit Rollback Mechanisms
abstract: With recent advancements in large language models, web agents have been greatly improved. However, dealing with complex and dynamic web environments requires more advanced planning and search abilities. Previous studies usually adopt a greedy one-way search strategy, which may struggle to recover from erroneous states. In this work, we enhance web agents with an explicit rollback mechanism, enabling the agent to revert back to a previous state in its navigation trajectory. This mechanism gives the model the flexibility to directly control the search process, leading to an effective and efficient web navigation method. We conduct experiments on two live web navigation benchmarks with zero-shot and fine-tuning settings. The results demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed approach.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种增强网络代理的方法，通过引入显式回滚机制，使代理能够在导航轨迹中回退到之前的状态，从而提高在复杂动态网络环境中的导航效率和效果。
AI.motivation: 解决现有网络代理在复杂动态网络环境中因采用贪婪单向搜索策略而难以从错误状态恢复的问题。
AI.method: 引入显式回滚机制，使网络代理能够回退到导航轨迹中的先前状态，从而直接控制搜索过程。
AI.result: 在两个实时网络导航基准测试中，无论是零样本还是微调设置下，所提出的方法均显示出有效性。
AI.conclusion: 显式回滚机制显著提高了网络代理在复杂动态网络环境中的导航能力和效率，为未来的网络代理研究提供了新的方向。

title: Towards LLM Agents for Earth Observation
abstract: Earth Observation (EO) provides critical planetary data for environmental monitoring, disaster management, climate science, and other scientific domains. Here we ask: Are AI systems ready for reliable Earth Observation? We introduce \datasetnamenospace, a benchmark of 140 yes/no questions from NASA Earth Observatory articles across 13 topics and 17 satellite sensors. Using Google Earth Engine API as a tool, LLM agents can only achieve an accuracy of 33% because the code fails to run over 58% of the time. We improve the failure rate for open models by fine-tuning synthetic data, allowing much smaller models (Llama-3.1-8B) to achieve comparable accuracy to much larger ones (e.g., DeepSeek-R1). Taken together, our findings identify significant challenges to be solved before AI agents can automate earth observation, and suggest paths forward. The project page is available at

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了AI系统在地球观测（EO）中的可靠性，通过引入一个包含140个是/非问题的基准测试，评估了LLM代理在利用Google Earth Engine API时的表现。研究发现，尽管通过微调合成数据可以改善较小模型的性能，但AI代理在地球观测自动化方面仍面临重大挑战。
AI.motivation: 解决AI系统在地球观测领域的可靠性和自动化能力问题，评估当前AI技术在处理地球观测数据时的表现和限制。
AI.method: 引入一个包含140个是/非问题的基准测试，覆盖13个主题和17个卫星传感器，使用Google Earth Engine API作为工具，评估LLM代理的性能，并通过微调合成数据改善模型表现。
AI.result: LLM代理在使用Google Earth Engine API时仅达到33%的准确率，代码运行失败率超过58%。通过微调合成数据，较小的模型（如Llama-3.1-8B）可以达到与更大模型（如DeepSeek-R1）相当的准确率。
AI.conclusion: 研究揭示了AI代理在地球观测自动化方面面临的重大挑战，并提出了通过微调合成数据等方法来改善模型性能的路径。

title: Advancing Arabic Speech Recognition Through Large-Scale Weakly Supervised Learning
abstract: Automatic speech recognition (ASR) is crucial for human-machine interaction in diverse applications like conversational agents, industrial robotics, call center automation, and automated subtitling. However, developing high-performance ASR models remains challenging, particularly for low-resource languages like Arabic, due to the scarcity of large, labeled speech datasets, which are costly and labor-intensive to produce. In this work, we employ weakly supervised learning to train an Arabic ASR model using the Conformer architecture. Our model is trained from scratch on 15,000 hours of weakly annotated speech data covering both Modern Standard Arabic (MSA) and Dialectal Arabic (DA), eliminating the need for costly manual transcriptions. Despite the absence of human-verified labels, our approach attains state-of-the-art (SOTA) performance, exceeding all previous efforts in the field of Arabic ASR on the standard benchmarks. By demonstrating the effectiveness of weak supervision as a scalable, cost-efficient alternative to traditional supervised approaches, paving the way for improved ASR systems in low resource settings.

AI.tldr: 通过大规模弱监督学习推进阿拉伯语语音识别
AI.motivation: 解决阿拉伯语等低资源语言在自动语音识别(ASR)领域中，由于缺乏大型标注语音数据集而面临的挑战
AI.method: 使用Conformer架构，通过15,000小时的弱标注语音数据（包括现代标准阿拉伯语和方言阿拉伯语）从头开始训练模型
AI.result: 尽管缺乏人工验证的标签，该方法在阿拉伯语ASR的标准基准测试中达到了最先进的性能
AI.conclusion: 证明了弱监督学习作为传统监督学习方法的一种可扩展、成本效益高的替代方案的有效性，为低资源环境下的ASR系统改进铺平了道路

title: Adapting a World Model for Trajectory Following in a 3D Game
abstract: Imitation learning is a powerful tool for training agents by leveraging expert knowledge, and being able to replicate a given trajectory is an integral part of it. In complex environments, like modern 3D video games, distribution shift and stochasticity necessitate robust approaches beyond simple action replay. In this study, we apply Inverse Dynamics Models (IDM) with different encoders and policy heads to trajectory following in a modern 3D video game -- Bleeding Edge. Additionally, we investigate several future alignment strategies that address the distribution shift caused by the aleatoric uncertainty and imperfections of the agent. We measure both the trajectory deviation distance and the first significant deviation point between the reference and the agent's trajectory and show that the optimal configuration depends on the chosen setting. Our results show that in a diverse data setting, a GPT-style policy head with an encoder trained from scratch performs the best, DINOv2 encoder with the GPT-style policy head gives the best results in the low data regime, and both GPT-style and MLP-style policy heads had comparable results when pre-trained on a diverse setting and fine-tuned for a specific behaviour setting.
subjects: Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV); Machine Learning (cs.LG)

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了在现代3D视频游戏中使用逆动力学模型（IDM）和不同编码器及策略头进行轨迹跟随的方法，并研究了解决分布偏移的未来对齐策略。结果表明，不同配置在不同数据设置下表现最佳。
AI.motivation: 解决在现代3D视频游戏中，由于分布偏移和随机性导致的简单动作回放不足以实现稳健轨迹跟随的问题。
AI.method: 应用逆动力学模型（IDM）与不同编码器和策略头，并研究未来对齐策略以减少分布偏移。
AI.result: 在多样化数据设置中，从头开始训练的GPT风格策略头表现最佳；在低数据情况下，DINOv2编码器与GPT风格策略头组合效果最好；在预训练后微调特定行为设置时，GPT风格和MLP风格策略头表现相当。
AI.conclusion: 研究表明，选择合适的编码器和策略头配置对于在不同数据设置下实现最佳轨迹跟随性能至关重要。

title: Multilingual Contextualization of Large Language Models for Document-Level Machine Translation
abstract: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated strong performance in sentence-level machine translation, but scaling to document-level translation remains challenging, particularly in modeling long-range dependencies and discourse phenomena across sentences and paragraphs. In this work, we propose a method to improve LLM-based long-document translation through targeted fine-tuning on high-quality document-level data, which we curate and introduce as DocBlocks. Our approach supports multiple translation paradigms, including direct document-to-document and chunk-level translation, by integrating instructions both with and without surrounding context. This enables models to better capture cross-sentence dependencies while maintaining strong sentence-level translation performance. Experimental results show that incorporating multiple translation paradigms improves document-level translation quality and inference speed compared to prompting and agent-based methods.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种通过针对高质量文档级数据进行微调来改进基于大型语言模型的长文档翻译的方法，支持多种翻译范式，实验结果表明该方法在文档级翻译质量和推理速度上优于提示和基于代理的方法。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型在句子级机器翻译中表现出色，但在文档级翻译中建模长距离依赖和跨句子、段落的语篇现象仍具挑战性。
AI.method: 通过在高品质文档级数据（DocBlocks）上进行针对性微调，支持包括直接文档到文档和块级翻译在内的多种翻译范式，整合有和没有周围上下文的指令。
AI.result: 实验结果显示，结合多种翻译范式相比提示和基于代理的方法，提高了文档级翻译的质量和推理速度。
AI.conclusion: 本文的方法通过特定微调和多翻译范式的整合，有效提升了大型语言模型在文档级机器翻译中的性能，同时保持了句子级翻译的强表现。

title: Perceptions of Agentic AI in Organizations: Implications for Responsible AI and ROI
abstract: As artificial intelligence (AI) systems rapidly gain autonomy, the need for robust responsible AI frameworks becomes paramount. This paper investigates how organizations perceive and adapt such frameworks amidst the emerging landscape of increasingly sophisticated agentic AI. Employing an interpretive qualitative approach, the study explores the lived experiences of AI professionals. Findings highlight that the inherent complexity of agentic AI systems and their responsible implementation, rooted in the intricate interconnectedness of responsible AI dimensions and the thematic framework (an analytical structure developed from the data), combined with the novelty of agentic AI, contribute to significant challenges in organizational adaptation, characterized by knowledge gaps, a limited emphasis on stakeholder engagement, and a strong focus on control. These factors, by hindering effective adaptation and implementation, ultimately compromise the potential for responsible AI and the realization of ROI.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了组织如何感知和适应日益复杂的自主人工智能（AI）系统中的负责任AI框架。通过定性研究方法，研究发现自主AI系统的复杂性和新颖性，以及负责任AI维度的相互关联性，给组织适应带来了挑战，影响了负责任AI的实施和投资回报率（ROI）的实现。
AI.motivation: 随着人工智能系统自主性的迅速增强，建立强大的负责任AI框架变得至关重要。本文旨在探索组织在这一新兴领域中如何感知和适应这些框架。
AI.method: 采用解释性定性方法，研究探索了AI专业人士的生活经验。
AI.result: 研究发现，自主AI系统的固有复杂性、负责任AI维度的相互关联性以及自主AI的新颖性，共同导致了组织适应中的重大挑战，包括知识差距、对利益相关者参与的有限重视以及对控制的强烈关注。
AI.conclusion: 这些因素通过阻碍有效的适应和实施，最终损害了负责任AI的潜力和ROI的实现。研究强调了在组织层面加强负责任AI框架的必要性，以应对自主AI带来的挑战。

title: Achieving Tighter Finite-Time Rates for Heterogeneous Federated Stochastic Approximation under Markovian Sampling
abstract: Motivated by collaborative reinforcement learning (RL) and optimization with time-correlated data, we study a generic federated stochastic approximation problem involving $M$ agents, where each agent is characterized by an agent-specific (potentially nonlinear) local operator. The goal is for the agents to communicate intermittently via a server to find the root of the average of the agents' local operators. The generality of our setting stems from allowing for (i) Markovian data at each agent and (ii) heterogeneity in the roots of the agents' local operators. The limited recent work that has accounted for both these features in a federated setting fails to guarantee convergence to the desired point or to show any benefit of collaboration; furthermore, they rely on projection steps in their algorithms to guarantee bounded iterates. Our work overcomes each of these limitations. We develop a novel algorithm titled \texttt{FedHSA}, and prove that it guarantees convergence to the correct point, while enjoying an $M$-fold linear speedup in sample-complexity due to collaboration. To our knowledge, \emph{this is the first finite-time result of its kind}, and establishing it (without relying on a projection step) entails a fairly intricate argument that accounts for the interplay between complex temporal correlations due to Markovian sampling, multiple local steps to save communication, and the drift-effects induced by heterogeneous local operators. Our results have implications for a broad class of heterogeneous federated RL problems (e.g., policy evaluation and control) with function approximation, where the agents' Markov decision processes can differ in their probability transition kernels and reward functions.
subjects: Machine Learning (cs.LG); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Systems and Control (eess.SY); Optimization and Control (math.OC)

AI.tldr: 本文研究了一个涉及M个代理的通用联邦随机逼近问题，旨在通过间歇性通信找到代理本地操作平均值的根。克服了现有工作中的限制，提出了一种新算法FedHSA，证明了其正确收敛性，并展示了由于协作带来的样本复杂度线性加速。
AI.motivation: 解决在马尔可夫采样和异构本地操作根的情况下，联邦随机逼近问题中的收敛性和协作效益问题。
AI.method: 开发了一种名为FedHSA的新算法，该算法不依赖投影步骤，能够处理马尔可夫采样带来的复杂时间相关性、多局部步骤以节省通信以及异构本地操作引起的漂移效应。
AI.result: FedHSA算法保证了向正确点的收敛，并由于协作实现了样本复杂度的M倍线性加速。
AI.conclusion: 这是首次在不依赖投影步骤的情况下，证明了在马尔可夫采样和异构本地操作根的条件下联邦随机逼近问题的有限时间结果，对一类广泛的异构联邦强化学习问题具有重要影响。

title: Progent: Programmable Privilege Control for LLM Agents
abstract: LLM agents are an emerging form of AI systems where large language models (LLMs) serve as the central component, utilizing a diverse set of tools to complete user-assigned tasks. Despite their great potential, LLM agents pose significant security risks. When interacting with the external world, they may encounter malicious commands from attackers, leading to the execution of dangerous actions. A promising way to address this is by enforcing the principle of least privilege: allowing only essential actions for task completion while blocking unnecessary ones. However, achieving this is challenging, as it requires covering diverse agent scenarios while preserving both security and utility.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了Progent，一种为LLM代理设计的可编程权限控制系统，旨在通过实施最小权限原则来减少安全风险。
AI.motivation: LLM代理在完成任务时可能执行来自攻击者的恶意命令，导致安全风险。为了解决这一问题，需要一种既能覆盖多样化的代理场景，又能保持安全和实用性的方法。
AI.method: Progent通过实施最小权限原则，仅允许完成任务所必需的动作，同时阻止不必要的动作，以此来控制LLM代理的权限。
AI.result: Progent提供了一种有效的方法来减少LLM代理在执行任务时的安全风险，同时保持了其功能性。
AI.conclusion: 通过实施最小权限原则，Progent为LLM代理提供了一种既安全又实用的权限控制方法，有助于减少潜在的安全威胁。

title: Causality-enhanced Decision-Making for Autonomous Mobile Robots in Dynamic Environments
abstract: The growing integration of robots in shared environments -- such as warehouses, shopping centres, and hospitals -- demands a deep understanding of the underlying dynamics and human behaviours, including how, when, and where individuals engage in various activities and interactions. This knowledge goes beyond simple correlation studies and requires a more comprehensive causal analysis. By leveraging causal inference to model cause-and-effect relationships, we can better anticipate critical environmental factors and enable autonomous robots to plan and execute tasks more effectively. To this end, we propose a novel causality-based decision-making framework that reasons over a learned causal model to predict battery usage and human obstructions, understanding how these factors could influence robot task execution. Such reasoning framework assists the robot in deciding when and how to complete a given task. To achieve this, we developed also PeopleFlow, a new Gazebo-based simulator designed to model context-sensitive human-robot spatial interactions in shared workspaces. PeopleFlow features realistic human and robot trajectories influenced by contextual factors such as time, environment layout, and robot state, and can simulate a large number of agents. While the simulator is general-purpose, in this paper we focus on a warehouse-like environment as a case study, where we conduct an extensive evaluation benchmarking our causal approach against a non-causal baseline. Our findings demonstrate the efficacy of the proposed solutions, highlighting how causal reasoning enables autonomous robots to operate more efficiently and safely in dynamic environments shared with humans.
comments: Under review at The International Journal of Robotics Research (IJRR)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于因果推理的决策框架，旨在通过建模因果关系来预测电池使用和人为障碍，从而帮助自主机器人在动态环境中更有效地规划和执行任务。研究还开发了PeopleFlow模拟器，用于模拟人机空间交互，并在仓库环境中验证了因果方法的有效性。
AI.motivation: 随着机器人在共享环境中的集成度越来越高，需要超越简单的相关性研究，进行更全面的因果分析，以更好地预测关键环境因素，使自主机器人能更有效地规划和执行任务。
AI.method: 研究提出了一种基于因果推理的决策框架，并开发了PeopleFlow模拟器，该模拟器能够模拟受时间、环境布局和机器人状态等上下文因素影响的人类和机器人轨迹。
AI.result: 在仓库环境的案例研究中，与无因果基线相比，因果推理方法显示出更高的效率和安全性。
AI.conclusion: 因果推理使自主机器人在与人类共享的动态环境中能够更高效、更安全地操作。

title: ARCeR: an Agentic RAG for the Automated Definition of Cyber Ranges
abstract: The growing and evolving landscape of cybersecurity threats necessitates the development of supporting tools and platforms that allow for the creation of realistic IT environments operating within virtual, controlled settings as Cyber Ranges (CRs). CRs can be exploited for analyzing vulnerabilities and experimenting with the effectiveness of devised countermeasures, as well as serving as training environments for building cyber security skills and abilities for IT operators. This paper proposes ARCeR as an innovative solution for the automatic generation and deployment of CRs, starting from user-provided descriptions in a natural language. ARCeR relies on the Agentic RAG paradigm, which allows it to fully exploit state-of-art AI technologies. Experimental results show that ARCeR is able to successfully process prompts even in cases that LLMs or basic RAG systems are not able to cope with. Furthermore, ARCeR is able to target any CR framework provided that specific knowledge is made available to it.

AI.tldr: ARCeR是一种基于Agentic RAG的创新解决方案，用于从用户提供的自然语言描述中自动生成和部署网络靶场（Cyber Ranges）。
AI.motivation: 网络安全威胁的不断增长和演变需要开发支持工具和平台，以创建在虚拟、受控环境中运行的现实IT环境，即网络靶场（CRs）。
AI.method: ARCeR依赖于Agentic RAG范式，充分利用了最先进的人工智能技术。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，ARCeR能够成功处理即使在大型语言模型（LLMs）或基本RAG系统无法应对的情况下也能处理的提示。
AI.conclusion: ARCeR能够针对任何CR框架，前提是向其提供了特定的知识，这为网络安全技能和能力的培训提供了新的可能性。

title: Communication Optimization for Decentralized Learning atop Bandwidth-limited Edge Networks
abstract: Decentralized federated learning (DFL) is a promising machine learning paradigm for bringing artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities to the network edge. Running DFL on top of edge networks, however, faces severe performance challenges due to the extensive parameter exchanges between agents. Most existing solutions for these challenges were based on simplistic communication models, which cannot capture the case of learning over a multi-hop bandwidth-limited network. In this work, we address this problem by jointly designing the communication scheme for the overlay network formed by the agents and the mixing matrix that controls the communication demands between the agents. By carefully analyzing the properties of our problem, we cast each design problem into a tractable optimization and develop an efficient algorithm with guaranteed performance. Our evaluations based on real topology and data show that the proposed algorithm can reduce the total training time by over $80\%$ compared to the baseline without sacrificing accuracy, while significantly improving the computational efficiency over the state of the art.
subjects: Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC); Machine Learning (cs.LG)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种在带宽有限的边缘网络上优化去中心化联邦学习通信的方法，通过联合设计代理之间的覆盖网络通信方案和混合矩阵，显著减少了总训练时间。
AI.motivation: 去中心化联邦学习（DFL）在边缘网络上的运行面临由于代理间大量参数交换导致的性能挑战，现有解决方案基于简化的通信模型，无法捕捉在多跳带宽有限网络上的学习情况。
AI.method: 通过分析问题特性，将每个设计问题转化为可处理的优化问题，并开发了一种保证性能的高效算法。
AI.result: 基于真实拓扑和数据的评估显示，所提算法在不牺牲准确性的情况下，将总训练时间减少了80%以上，同时显著提高了计算效率。
AI.conclusion: 本研究为在带宽有限的边缘网络上实现高效的DFL提供了有效的通信优化方案，显著提升了训练效率和计算性能。

title: Enhancing Web Agents with Explicit Rollback Mechanisms
abstract: With recent advancements in large language models, web agents have been greatly improved. However, dealing with complex and dynamic web environments requires more advanced planning and search abilities. Previous studies usually adopt a greedy one-way search strategy, which may struggle to recover from erroneous states. In this work, we enhance web agents with an explicit rollback mechanism, enabling the agent to revert back to a previous state in its navigation trajectory. This mechanism gives the model the flexibility to directly control the search process, leading to an effective and efficient web navigation method. We conduct experiments on two live web navigation benchmarks with zero-shot and fine-tuning settings. The results demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed approach.

AI.tldr: 通过引入显式回滚机制增强网络代理的能力，使其能够在复杂的网络环境中更有效地导航和恢复错误状态。
AI.motivation: 解决网络代理在复杂和动态网络环境中因采用贪婪单向搜索策略而难以从错误状态恢复的问题。
AI.method: 在网络代理中引入显式回滚机制，允许代理在导航轨迹中回滚到之前的状态，从而直接控制搜索过程。
AI.result: 在两个实时网络导航基准测试中，无论是零射击还是微调设置，提出的方法都显示出了有效性。
AI.conclusion: 显式回滚机制为网络代理提供了一种高效且有效的导航方法，增强了其在复杂网络环境中的适应性和灵活性。

title: A Visual RAG Pipeline for Few-Shot Fine-Grained Product Classification
abstract: Despite the rapid evolution of learning and computer vision algorithms, Fine-Grained Classification (FGC) still poses an open problem in many practically relevant applications. In the retail domain, for example, the identification of fast changing and visually highly similar products and their properties are key to automated price-monitoring and product recommendation. This paper presents a novel Visual RAG pipeline that combines the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) approach and Vision Language Models (VLMs) for few-shot FGC. This Visual RAG pipeline extracts product and promotion data in advertisement leaflets from various retailers and simultaneously predicts fine-grained product ids along with price and discount information. Compared to previous approaches, the key characteristic of the Visual RAG pipeline is that it allows the prediction of novel products without re-training, simply by adding a few class samples to the RAG database. Comparing several VLM back-ends like GPT-4o [23], GPT-4o-mini [24], and Gemini 2.0 Flash [10], our approach achieves 86.8% accuracy on a diverse dataset.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新颖的Visual RAG管道，结合了检索增强生成（RAG）方法和视觉语言模型（VLMs），用于少样本细粒度分类（FGC），在零售领域中实现了高准确度的产品识别和价格信息预测。
AI.motivation: 解决细粒度分类（FGC）在零售领域中识别快速变化且视觉高度相似产品及其属性的挑战，以支持自动化价格监控和产品推荐。
AI.method: 采用Visual RAG管道，结合RAG方法和VLMs，通过从广告传单中提取产品和促销数据，预测细粒度产品ID及价格和折扣信息，无需重新训练即可预测新产品。
AI.result: 在多样化的数据集上，使用不同的VLM后端（如GPT-4o、GPT-4o-mini和Gemini 2.0 Flash），达到了86.8%的准确率。
AI.conclusion: Visual RAG管道为少样本细粒度产品分类提供了一种高效且灵活的方法，能够适应新产品的识别需求，具有重要的实际应用价值。

title: GrabS: Generative Embodied Agent for 3D Object Segmentation without Scene Supervision
abstract: We study the hard problem of 3D object segmentation in complex point clouds without requiring human labels of 3D scenes for supervision. By relying on the similarity of pretrained 2D features or external signals such as motion to group 3D points as objects, existing unsupervised methods are usually limited to identifying simple objects like cars or their segmented objects are often inferior due to the lack of objectness in pretrained features. In this paper, we propose a new two-stage pipeline called GrabS. The core concept of our method is to learn generative and discriminative object-centric priors as a foundation from object datasets in the first stage, and then design an embodied agent to learn to discover multiple objects by querying against the pretrained generative priors in the second stage. We extensively evaluate our method on two real-world datasets and a newly created synthetic dataset, demonstrating remarkable segmentation performance, clearly surpassing all existing unsupervised methods.
subjects: Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Machine Learning (cs.LG); Robotics (cs.RO)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为GrabS的两阶段流程，用于无需场景监督的3D对象分割。该方法首先从对象数据集中学习生成和判别性的对象中心先验，然后在第二阶段设计一个体现代理，通过查询预训练的生成先验来学习发现多个对象。在多个数据集上的评估表明，该方法在分割性能上显著优于所有现有的无监督方法。
AI.motivation: 解决在复杂点云中进行3D对象分割的难题，而不需要人类对3D场景的标签进行监督。现有的无监督方法通常依赖于预训练的2D特征的相似性或外部信号（如运动）来将3D点分组为对象，这些方法通常仅限于识别简单对象（如汽车）或其分割对象由于预训练特征中缺乏对象性而表现不佳。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为GrabS的两阶段流程。第一阶段从对象数据集中学习生成和判别性的对象中心先验作为基础；第二阶段设计一个体现代理，通过查询预训练的生成先验来学习发现多个对象。
AI.result: 在两个真实世界数据集和一个新创建的合成数据集上进行了广泛评估，展示了显著的分割性能，明显超过了所有现有的无监督方法。
AI.conclusion: GrabS方法通过学习和利用生成和判别性的对象中心先验，有效地解决了无需场景监督的3D对象分割问题，其性能显著优于现有方法。

title: Enhancing Autonomous Driving Systems with On-Board Deployed Large Language Models
abstract: Neural Networks (NNs) trained through supervised learning struggle with managing edge-case scenarios common in real-world driving due to the intractability of exhaustive datasets covering all edge-cases, making knowledge-driven approaches, akin to how humans intuitively detect unexpected driving behavior, a suitable complement to data-driven methods. This work proposes a hybrid architecture combining low-level Model Predictive Controller (MPC) with locally deployed Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance decision-making and Human Machine Interaction (HMI). The DecisionxLLM module evaluates robotic state information against natural language instructions to ensure adherence to desired driving behavior. The MPCxLLM module then adjusts MPC parameters based on LLM-generated insights, achieving control adaptability while preserving the safety and constraint guarantees of traditional MPC systems. Further, to enable efficient on-board deployment and to eliminate dependency on cloud connectivity, we shift processing to the on-board computing platform: We propose an approach that exploits Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), Low Rank Adaptation (LoRA) fine-tuning, and quantization. Experimental results demonstrate that these enhancements yield significant improvements in reasoning accuracy by up to 10.45%, control adaptability by as much as 52.2%, and up to 10.5x increase in computational efficiency (tokens/s), validating the proposed framework's practicality for real-time deployment even on down-scaled robotic platforms. This work bridges high-level decision-making with low-level control adaptability, offering a synergistic framework for knowledge-driven and adaptive Autonomous Driving Systems (ADS).

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种结合低层模型预测控制器（MPC）与本地部署的大型语言模型（LLMs）的混合架构，以增强自动驾驶系统的决策制定和人机交互（HMI）。通过DecisionxLLM和MPCxLLM模块，系统能够根据自然语言指令调整MPC参数，实现控制适应性，同时保持传统MPC系统的安全和约束保证。此外，通过采用检索增强生成（RAG）、低秩适应（LoRA）微调和量化技术，实现了高效的板载部署，显著提高了推理准确性、控制适应性和计算效率。
AI.motivation: 解决监督学习训练的神经网络在现实驾驶中难以处理所有边缘案例的问题，通过知识驱动的方法补充数据驱动方法，提高自动驾驶系统在边缘案例中的表现。
AI.method: 提出了一种混合架构，结合了低层MPC和本地部署的LLMs，利用DecisionxLLM和MPCxLLM模块进行决策和控制参数调整，采用RAG、LoRA微调和量化技术实现高效板载部署。
AI.result: 实验结果显示，该方法在推理准确性上提高了10.45%，控制适应性提高了52.2%，计算效率提高了10.5倍（tokens/s），验证了框架在实时部署中的实用性。
AI.conclusion: 本研究通过结合高层决策制定与低层控制适应性，为知识驱动和自适应的自动驾驶系统提供了一个协同框架，展示了在缩小规模的机器人平台上实时部署的可行性。

title: REAL: Benchmarking Autonomous Agents on Deterministic Simulations of Real Websites
abstract: We introduce REAL, a benchmark and framework for multi-turn agent evaluations on deterministic simulations of real-world websites. REAL comprises high-fidelity, deterministic replicas of 11 widely-used websites across domains such as e-commerce, travel, communication, and professional networking. We also release a benchmark consisting of 112 practical tasks that mirror everyday complex user interactions requiring both accurate information retrieval and state-changing actions. All interactions occur within this fully controlled setting, eliminating safety risks and enabling robust, reproducible evaluation of agent capability and reliability. Our novel evaluation framework combines programmatic checks of website state for action-based tasks with rubric-guided LLM-based judgments for information retrieval.
